name: SpotBugs
body:
SpotBugs is a program which uses static analysis to look for bugs in Java code.  It is free software, distributed under the terms of the [Lesser GNU Public License](http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl.html).

SpotBugs is the spiritual sucessor of [FindBugs](http://findbugs.sourceforge.net/), carrying on from the point where it left off with support of its community.

SpotBugs requires JRE (or JDK) 1.7.0 or later to run.  However, it can analyze programs compiled for any version of Java, from 1.0 to 1.8.

### Bug Descriptions
SpotBugs checks for more that 400 bug patterns. Bug descriptions can be found [here](/bugDescriptions.html)

Descriptions are also available in [Japanese](/bugDescriptions_ja.html) and [French](/bugDescriptions_fr.html)

### Using SpotBugs

SpotBugs can be used standalone and through several integrations, including:

* Ant
* [Maven](http://gleclaire.github.io/findbugs-maven-plugin/)
* [Gradle](https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/findbugs_plugin.html)
* Eclipse

### Extensions
SpotBugs is extensible. New detectors can be added through plugins. Popular SpotBugs plugins include:

* [fb-contrib](http://fb-contrib.sourceforge.net/)
* [find-sec-bugs](http://h3xstream.github.io/find-sec-bugs/)

### Documentation
[API](https://spotbugs.github.io/api/index.html) \[[no frames](https://spotbugs.github.io/api/overview-summary.html)\]

### Support or Contact
You can contact us and report issues on [GitHub](https://github.com/spotbugs/spotbugs/issues)
